common_issues.title: PiecesOS Launch Issues
common_issues.description: Users reported PiecesOS failing to launch or crashing after update 11.1.1, primarily due to hardware incompatibility and AVX2 support issues. A patch (version 11.1.2) was released to address these problems, resolving the issues for most affected users.

related_issues.title: PiecesOS was unable to launch.
related_issues.text:
PiecesOS was unable to launch.
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

latest

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/7a6a7957-5aa1-4d53-b492-cf4470aa5edc)
## GitHub Issue Summary: PiecesOS Launch Issue (11.1.1)

**Key Points:**

* User reports inability to launch PiecesOS after updating to version 11.1.1.
* The issue is attributed to stricter hardware requirements in the new version.

**Problems Identified:**

* PiecesOS 11.1.1 launch fails for some users due to hardware incompatibility.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* A patch release (11.1.2) is planned to address the strict hardware requirements issue.
* Users are requested to provide logs for troubleshooting.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* Patch release 11.1.2 is deployed to mitigate the issue.
* Users are encouraged to update to 11.1.2 and report any further problems.

## Additional Notes:
* The issue is related to another GitHub issue (#625).
* The issue has been closed as resolved.

related_issues.title: PiecesOS crash immediately after launch
related_issues.text:
PiecesOS crash immediately after launch
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.1.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

After upgrade PiecesOS to version 11.1..1 it crashes every time immediately after launch. Previous version worked well. Attached is the crash report log.

Environment: 

- OS MacOS 15.2
- CPU Intel 

[trace.log](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/18777512/trace.log)
## Summary of the GitHub Issue conversation

**Key Points Raised:**

- The user reported an issue with the application not launching.
- The issue seems related to the new vector library having AVX2 issues.

**Problems Identified:**

- New vector libraries lacked support for AVX2 on specific processors.
- This caused issues for users with older CPUs, including the user's Intel(R) Core(TM) i5-3210M CPU, which was released before 2016/2017.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

- The team actively worked to resolve the AVX2 issue.
- A new release (version 11.1.2) was published with the fix.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

- User confirmed the issue is fixed with version 11.1.2 and the application functions properly now.

**Conclusion:** 

The conversation demonstrates effective troubleshooting, communication, and resolution of the reported issue by the team. The user's feedback and provided CPU information were crucial for identifying and fixing the problem.

### Software

### Operating System / Platform

### Your Pieces OS Version

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

i had no issues with it in the begining but now when i try to open it now i encounter this error message 

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/e929cf56-d8a1-4185-8167-867ede2048e7)
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation:

**Key Points:**

* User `C2mokete` reported an issue with PiecesOS taking a long time to boot.
* The issue was automatically triaged and routed to the Pieces team.
* The user was provided with links to similar issues and helpful resources.
* Mark from Pieces suggested trying the newly released PiecesOS version 11.1.2.

**Problems Identified:**

* PiecesOS took a long time to boot.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Mark suggested trying the newly released PiecesOS version 11.1.2.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue was closed by Mark.

**Additional Notes:**

* The user did not provide any feedback on whether the issue was resolved after trying the new version. 
* If the issue persists, the user can reopen the issue.

recommendations: **Prioritize Hardware Compatibility Testing:** The influx of "PiecesOS Launch Issues" related to hardware incompatibility after the 11.1.1 update highlights the need for more robust testing across a wider range of hardware configurations before major releases.

**Improve Communication on Update Impacts:**  Clearly communicate hardware requirements or potential compatibility issues to users before they update to a new version of PiecesOS. This could involve release notes, in-app notifications, or blog posts.

**Enhance AVX2 Support Documentation:** Provide clear and accessible documentation for users about AVX2 support requirements, including how to check their system's compatibility and potential workarounds if their hardware doesn't meet the requirements.

**Investigate and Optimize Core Services Boot Time:** The report of slow boot times related to "core services" warrants further investigation. Optimizing core services startup can significantly improve the user experience.
